index.metaDescription: Kevin Lee — Software Engineer, Pilot, Photographer. Building at Microsoft AI.
index.bio1: I'm Kevin — a software engineer at Microsoft AI working on Copilot and large-scale data pipelines. Before that I interned at NASA JPL, studied CS at USC, and served in the Army.
index.bio2: On the side I run a small software company called PookieB — 10 products and counting across web, iOS, and AI/ML. I like building things that are genuinely useful.
index.bio3: When I'm not coding, I'm usually flying. I volunteer with Angel Flight West doing medical transport flights around the Pacific Northwest. I also surf, take photos, and travel whenever I can.

resume.uscDegree: University of Southern California — B.S. Computer Science, Viterbi School of Engineering | May 2022
resume.uscHonors: Honors: Army ROTC Full Scholarship, Pathway Oregon Full Scholarship, Armed Forces Award, Dean's List
resume.uscCerts: Certifications: Winner of 2022 Microsoft Global Hackathon Industry Executive Challenge
resume.msftTitle: Microsoft AI — Software Engineer | Redmond, WA | Aug 2022 – Present
resume.msftBullet1: Built and shipping new Copilot settings experience across backend and frontend in C++
resume.msftBullet2: Designed and operating large-scale Azure data pipelines for Copilot, Edge, and Windows, processing 40TB+ of user metadata per day and cutting end-to-end latency from 72 to 24 hours (3x) to accelerate A/B experimentation
resume.msftBullet3: Architected cost-optimization initiatives for high-scale Azure data infrastructure, reducing annual cloud spend by $240K+ while maintaining 99.9%+ uptime and improving pipeline reliability
resume.msftBullet4: Led a 12-person cross-functional team to win the 2022 Microsoft Global Hackathon by building an AI-powered Alzheimer's detection tool for researchers
resume.aclTitle: ACL Solutions LLC (PookieB) — Founder & Software Engineer | Remote | 2024 – Present
resume.aclDesc: Founded a software company building 10 consumer and developer products across full-stack web, iOS, and AI/ML:
resume.aclBullet1: Shredders — Real-time powder tracking app for 28 PNW ski resorts. Next.js 16 + React 19 frontend, Supabase backend with 90 API endpoints, SwiftUI iOS app with push notifications and Apple Sign-In. 8-factor powder scoring, 7-day forecasts, AI chat (Claude + GPT-4), and social events with RSVP/carpool coordination.
resume.aclBullet2: Pookie B News Daily — Automated news aggregation and podcast platform. Flask + DynamoDB backend scraping 9 sources, AI-generated summaries (GPT-4o-mini), NPR-style podcast episodes via custom ElevenLabs TTS voice. iOS app with widgets, web dashboard with D3.js analytics. Daily scraping + weekly podcast via GitHub Actions.
resume.aclBullet3: SmartSpender — AI financial decision engine with a 3-stage pipeline (natural language → deterministic calculations → narrative). 13 AWS Lambda functions orchestrated by Step Functions, Amazon Bedrock Claude for analysis, GPT-4o Vision for receipt OCR. 10 DynamoDB tables, SwiftUI companion app for receipt splitting.
resume.aclBullet4: SPACEc — Stanford academic Python library for multiplexed imaging analysis, published on PyPI and bioRxiv. 19K lines of Python. Cell segmentation (Cellpose, DeepCell), GPU-accelerated clustering, STELLAR GNN annotation, and novel Patch Proximity Analysis. 19 notebooks, full CI/CD, Docker support.
resume.aclBullet5: Also built: DayByDay (social journaling), Harmony Tracker (AI relationship coach), Wilco (ATC radio trainer), San Jose ADU Checker (GIS permit tool), klee.page (portfolio), ACL Solutions site
resume.broadTitle: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard — Researcher | Boston, MA | May 2022 – Sep 2022
resume.broadBullet1: Laboratory of Dr. Guoping Feng — classified spatial scRNA-seq data (MERFISH) to subthalamic nuclei regions with machine learning using DAPI/POLYT scans from Allen Brain Institute
resume.broadBullet2: Built and managed relationships with medical scientists at Harvard Children's Hospital, translating MERFISH data into manageable digital solutions
resume.armyTitle: U.S. Army — Soldier | West Point, NY | Sep 2017 – May 2022
resume.armyBullet1: Coordinated small-unit tactical operations and field training exercises as a United States Army Cadet (E-5), ensuring mission success under high-pressure conditions
resume.armyBullet2: Managed technical and logistical support in the Battalion S-4 unit, optimizing resource allocation through data-driven decision-making
resume.rbiTitle: Red Berry Innovations — Software Engineer Intern | Omaha, NE | Apr 2020 – Jun 2020
resume.rbiBullet1: Classified vehicle sensor data from CAN bus systems using convolutional neural networks, coordinating with cross-functional teams for improved data analysis
resume.rbiBullet2: Developed solutions for vehicle movement and location tracking without GPS using complex dynamic sensor data
resume.nasaTitle: NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory — Software Engineering Intern | Pasadena, CA | Jun 2019 – Aug 2019
resume.nasaBullet1: Enhanced the Curiosity rover's operational efficiency by 8-12% through development of improvement models for mission-critical digital systems
resume.nasaBullet2: Presented work at the 2020 NASA conference on integrating advanced analytics and open-source technologies
resume.afwTitle: Angel Flight West — Pilot | Seattle, WA | Jun 2024 – Present
resume.afwDesc: Volunteer pilot providing critical medical transportation in the Puget Sound area

brock.pageTitle: Brock — A Year in the Life
brock.metaDescription: Brock — A photo story by Kevin Lee
brock.heroSubtitle: A year in the life of
brock.heroDesc: From city sidewalks to coastal cliffs, ER waiting rooms to autumn leaves. One little golden doodle, one very big year.
brock.ch1Tagline: Life in San Francisco. Coffee shops, coding sessions, and couch naps.
brock.ch1Caption1: The face of a dog who has fully claimed the couch.
brock.ch1Text1: Every morning, the same routine. Kevin codes. Brock supervises. The best coworker never sends a Slack message — he just nudges your hand when it's time for a walk.
brock.ch1Text2: Post-bath blowout. Not a fan of the hair dryer — but absolutely a fan of being fluffy.
brock.ch2Tagline: The late-night drives. The waiting room. The relief.
brock.ch2Caption1: Wrapped up safe. Everything's going to be okay.
brock.ch2Text1: Sterile panniculitis. Words no puppy parent wants to hear. It meant multiple ER visits, sleepless nights, and a kind of fear that made everything else disappear. It freaked Mom and Dad out — a lot. But Dr. Schnabl was a savior, and Brock pulled through. He's been blessed ever since.
brock.ch3Tagline: Coastlines, canoes, wildflowers, and the best camping buddy you could ask for.
brock.ch3Caption1: First mate Brock. Yellow vest, tongue out, ready for anything.
brock.ch3Text1: When his little legs got tired on the trail, Beryl carried him like a baby. He didn't seem to mind one bit.
brock.ch3Text2: Camping with a mini goldendoodle means sharing your sleeping bag, finding fur in your coffee, and waking up to a face that says: can we do this forever?
brock.ch4Tagline: San Francisco → South Bend, Indiana. 2,200 miles. One very good co-pilot.
brock.ch4Text1: Airplane carriers, golden hour on the highway, and that first night in a half-empty apartment surrounded by boxes. Home isn't the city. Home is whoever's on the couch with you.
brock.ch5Tagline: South Bend, Indiana. New town, same good boy.
brock.ch5Caption1: First fall in Indiana. The leaves didn't disappoint.
brock.ch5Text1: Notre Dame bandana on, blessed in the spirit of St. Francis. Technically, the first Catholic in the family. He moved Kevin and Beryl so much that day, they both joined OCIA. Leave it to a 15-pound goldendoodle to lead his parents to faith.
brock.ch5Text2: Dinner parties in the new kitchen. Movie nights with his favorite Mr. Bunny. Some things never change — and that's the whole point.
brock.epilogueText: Cities change. Zip codes change. But the little guy on the couch? He just wants to be wherever you are. And honestly, that's enough.
brock.footer: Made with love by Kevin & Beryl — klee.page
